intro: Cyrtandra × rockii, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant is a hybrid between Cyrtandra cariosperma and Cyrtandra pedunculata, resulting in unique morphological features. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
